title: Simulation-Based Intensive Training for Anaphylaxis Diagnosis and Treatment

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of medical terminology and fundamental knowledge of emergency response procedures
context.additional_context: Interdisciplinary simulation training for pre-service nurses, pharmacists, and doctors. Structured around hands-on practice using digital devices (tablets/simulators).

learning_goals: Accurately identify at least three anaphylaxis symptoms and classify clinical risk levels.
Apply epinephrine auto-injector (EpiPen) usage and timing of adrenaline administration with over 90% accuracy.
Complete team-based emergency response protocols within 15 minutes in simulation scenarios.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
